word.entryDescription: to travel on a bus
word.entryExample: We go by bus to the town centre.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to travel in a car
word.entryExample: Lucy goes home by car?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an informal word you say to someone when you are leaving a place
word.entryExample: Bye, see you tomorrow!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small restaurant which normally serves coffee and light meals
word.entryExample: I often have breakfast in the café.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a container for an animal made of bars or wire
word.entryExample: The rabbit is sleeping in his cage.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sweet food made from flour, eggs, fat and sugar especially to celebrate somebody's birthday
word.entryExample: I'd like a chocolate birthday cake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a young cow
word.entryExample: The calf stayed next to its mother.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to try and speak to someone by telephone
word.entryExample: Call me at 6 o'clock.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing you use for taking photographs
word.entryExample: I'm taking some photos with my new camera.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the activity of staying in a tent on holiday
word.entryExample: I don't like camping because I'm scared of spiders.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large North American country between the US and the Arctic Ocean
word.entryExample: Canada is a very big country.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a vehicle with an engine and four wheels which carries people on roads
word.entryExample: My mum drives a car to work.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thin piece of cardboard usually with a picture on it, a short form of the word postcard
word.entryExample: Can you send me a card when you are on holiday?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large thick covering for the floor
word.entryExample: There's a blue carpet in my bedroom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long thin orange vegetable which grows underground
word.entryExample: Can I give the rabbit a carrot?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a furry animal with a long tail, that people often keep as a pet
word.entryExample: Cats like to drink milk.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to take a fish out of water with a fishing rod (a long stick with a hook on the end)
word.entryExample: He's trying to catch a fish.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small round flat piece of plastic on which music or data can be stored
word.entryExample: I would love a music CD for my birthday present.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a device used for playing music CDs
word.entryExample: This CD player is great because it can also play MP3s.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a thing with a back and four legs that you sit on
word.entryExample: In the kitchen there's a table and four chairs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not costing very much money
word.entryExample: The shops in New York are cheaper than the shops in Sam's town.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a solid yellow or white food made from milk
word.entryExample: My cat likes cheese.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large thin member of the cat family with yellow-brown fur and black spots, which can run very fast
word.entryExample: The cheetah is the quickest animal in the world.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a young chicken; a very common bird that is farmed for its meat and eggs
word.entryExample: The baby chicks are one week old.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very common bird that people use for meat and eggs
word.entryExample: There's chicken for dinner.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a very large east Asian country next to India
word.entryExample: A lot of tea comes from China.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: long thin pieces of potato which are fried in a lot of oil
word.entryExample: Would you like chips or salad with your burger?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sweet brown solid food made from cocoa
word.entryExample: Jill likes chocolate biscuits.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to decide which thing you want from a number of possibilities
word.entryExample: Please choose your ice cream - lemon or strawberry?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a religious building for Christians
word.entryExample: You can cross the road next to the church.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a building where you can see a film
word.entryExample: Would you like to come to the cinema with me?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a public show in which acrobats, clowns and sometimes animals perform in a large tent
word.entryExample: Can we go to the circus tomorrow?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a large town
word.entryExample: What's the biggest city in your country?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a group of students who have a lesson together
word.entryExample: Welcome to my class!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a room where you have lessons in school
word.entryExample: We have lessons in this classroom.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to remove dirt from the surface of something
word.entryExample: Can you clean your room today, please?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to use your legs and arms to move up a tree or a tall structure
word.entryExample: Pete likes to climbs trees.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a device which measures and shows time, usually found on walls or buildings
word.entryExample: The clock in our living room shows the wrong time!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when you close something, you move it to cover an area that was open
word.entryExample: Close your books.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: things such a dresses and trousers that you wear to cover, protect and decorate your body
word.entryExample: I need to buy new clothes for the autumn.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a white or grey mass in the sky, made of very small drops of water
word.entryExample: There are lots of clouds in the sky.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when it is cloudy there are a lot of clouds
word.entryExample: It's too cloudy to go to the beach.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a person who makes people laugh and plays tricks in a circus or other show
word.entryExample: Look at the clown! Oh, he's really funny!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of clothing you wear when you are outside to stay warm
word.entryExample: Where's my coat?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a big brown hard fruit containing white flesh and white liquid
word.entryExample: These coconut cookies look very nice.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a hot bitter drink made from the coffee plant
word.entryExample: Would you like tea or coffee?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small restaurant where you can buy coffee and small meals
word.entryExample: Alex's mum was at the coffee shop yesterday morning.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: when it is cold thei air is a low temperature
word.entryExample: December is a cold month.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: red, blue, green, yellow, etc
word.entryExample: What colour are your eyes?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to arrive at home
word.entryExample: Children, come home now, it is starting to rain.
word.label: ydp
